Getting Figure 2 from the paper

  • Show All Code
  • Hide All Code
  • View Source

Code

import glob
from exps import *
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

model = ["SBM", "LFR"]
dr = { "SBM": (0, 40), "LFR": (0, 60) }
communities = ["Isolated_communities", "More_connected_communities"]

def degrees(network):
    return list(len(l) for l in network)

for m in model:
    for c in communities:
        files = glob.glob(f'../data/reference_communities/{c}/{m}/Run_*/twocommunities_edgelist.txt')
        l = []
        for f in files:
            n = read_graph(f)
            degs = degrees(n)
            l.extend(degs)
        print(l)
        plt.figure()
        hist(l, range=dr[m])
        plt.title(f'{m}, {c}')
        plt.xlabel("Node degree")
        plt.ylabel("Frequency")
        plt.show()

Source Code
---
title: "Getting Figure 2 from the paper"
---

```{python}
import glob
from exps import *
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

model = ["SBM", "LFR"]
dr = { "SBM": (0, 40), "LFR": (0, 60) }
communities = ["Isolated_communities", "More_connected_communities"]

def degrees(network):
    return list(len(l) for l in network)

for m in model:
    for c in communities:
        files = glob.glob(f'../data/reference_communities/{c}/{m}/Run_*/twocommunities_edgelist.txt')
        l = []
        for f in files:
            n = read_graph(f)
            degs = degrees(n)
            l.extend(degs)
        print(l)
        plt.figure()
        hist(l, range=dr[m])
        plt.title(f'{m}, {c}')
        plt.xlabel("Node degree")
        plt.ylabel("Frequency")
        plt.show()
```
